meanings.definition: To drag or pull out forcefully.
meanings.sent1: She outdrags the heavy suitcase from the closet.
meanings.sent2: The team outdrags their opponents in the tug-of-war competition.
meanings.sent3: The stubborn donkey outdrags the farmer, making him work harder.
meanings.sent4: His determination outdrags any obstacle in his path.
meanings.sent5: The magnet outdrags the paperclip with its strong pull.

meanings.definition: To surpass or outdo in dragging.
meanings.sent1: The powerful tractor outdrags all the other vehicles in the field.
meanings.sent2: She always outdrags her friends in the game of arm wrestling.
meanings.sent3: The snail outdrags the turtle in this slow race.
meanings.sent4: His enthusiasm outdrags everyone else's in the group.
meanings.sent5: The champion outdrags all competitors with her speed and skill.

meanings.definition: To be dragged out or pulled forcefully.
meanings.sent1: The cat outdrags its toy mouse from under the couch.
meanings.sent2: He outdrags himself out of bed every morning.
meanings.sent3: The kite outdrags the child, soaring high in the sky.
meanings.sent4: The river outdrags the debris downstream after the storm.
meanings.sent5: The wind outdrags the fallen leaves across the yard.
